Paper 1 Pure Mathematics 1 (P1)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 370, 418, 386]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 392, 460, 408]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: List of Formulae (MF9)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 418, 390, 435]]<|/det|>
READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 448, 787, 464]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name in the spaces at the top of this page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 464, 322, 479]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 479, 504, 495]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 495, 504, 510]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 510, 380, 525]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 539, 910, 570]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions in the space provided. If additional space is required, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet. The question number(s) must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 570, 910, 600]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 600, 598, 615]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 615, 608, 630]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 644, 756, 694]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together. The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question. The total number of marks for this paper is 75.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 670, 96]]<|/det|>
Showing all necessary working, solve the equation \(4x - 11x^{\frac{1}{2}} + 6 = 0.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 75, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
A line has equation \(y = x + 1\) and a curve has equation \(y = x^{2} + bx + 5\). Find the set of values of the constant \(b\) for which the line meets the curve.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 551, 92]]<|/det|>
The first term of a series is 6 and the second term is 2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[128, 104, 156, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
For the case where the series is an arithmetic progression, find the sum of the first 80 terms. [3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 540, 191, 559]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 540, 798, 559]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[126, 73, 156, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 344, 92]]<|/det|>
Show that the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[390, 92, 611, 127]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\cos\theta - 4}{\sin\theta} -\frac{4\sin\theta}{5\cos\theta - 2} = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 131, 541, 151]]<|/det|>
may be expressed as \(9\cos^2\theta - 22\cos \theta + 4 = 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 131, 920, 150]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 325, 316, 344]]<|/det|>

The vertical edges \(OF\), \(AD\) and \(BE\) have lengths 6 units, 4 units and 4 units respectively. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 72, 811, 94]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = \frac{1}{2} (4x - 3)^{-1}\). The point \(A\) on the curve has coordinates \(\left(1, \frac{1}{2}\right)\).

<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 106, 186, 123]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 73, 586, 92]]<|/det|>
The function g is defined by \(\mathrm{g}(x) = (x - 3)^2\) for \(x \geqslant 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[166, 100, 196, 117]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 100, 920, 134]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathrm{gg}(2x)\) can be expressed in the form \((2x - 3)^4 + b(2x - 3)^2 + c\), where \(b\) and \(c\) are constants to be found.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 116, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 349, 195, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[196, 349, 673, 368]]<|/det|>
Hence expand \(\mathrm{gg}(2x)\) completely, simplifying your answer.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 349, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
